DOC.brief_title: Factors Associated With Poor Dengue Outcomes Malaysia
DOC.detailed_description: Dengue important arthropod borne viral disease human . The World Health Organization estimate 70 % global risk population live WHO southeast Asia Western Pacific region , account nearly 75 % global disease burden dengue . The number report case dengue Malaysia increase fourfold 44.3 per 100 000 population 1999 181 per 100 000 2007 . Serologically confirmed case approximately half number report case . An increase dengue death adult population observe since 2002 . A study Vietnam show woman child appear increase risk dengue shock syndrome death . Children age 6-10 year high risk Dengue Shock Syndrome ( DSS ) . However , mortality high young child . However , study 560 adult dengue patient Martinique , Thomas L et al find severe dengue mainly male , elderly , present abdominal pain , cough diarrhoea . At present , vaccine cure dengue . Treatment mainly supportive symptom relief . Various measure employ decrease incidence dengue - mainly public health measure . However , 2014 see dramatic rise number confirm dengue case well mortality . This study aim analyse result national data collect e-Dengue Information System order determine factor associate disease outcome patient register January 2013 December 2014 . An epidemiological observational study do utilizing e-dengue data year 2013 till year 2014 . The inclusion criterion dengue case register e-Dengue information system 2013-2014 ; exclusion criterion . The primary outcome measurement disease outcome include recovery , hospitalisation death . All data collect analyzed use descriptive analysis , prevalence/incidence estimate ; regression model generate .
DOC.criteria: All dengue case eDengue Information System 20132014
